intro: Argostemma neurosepalum, commonly known as the narrow-sepal argostemma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five sepals that are narrow and pointed. The plant produces small, elliptic berries that are usually yellow or orange when mature. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
